Deleting a Folder or Item

Your privileges and access rights determine whether you have the ability to delete a folder or item. Folders and items that have been deleted disappear from the project view from that time forward; however, by rolling back the view, you can see them again.

Deleting a folder from a project deletes the items associated with that folder. It also deletes its child folders and their contents. However, it does not delete the working folder or any files in that folder.

If you delete a file from the application, you can choose not to delete it from your working folder. Therefore, you can remove a file from version control without removing it from your workstation.

Deleting a task or subtask from a folder deletes its subtasks –  that is, the entire branch for which the selected task is the root. The same principle holds for topics and responses.

Be aware that deletions made in the parent view are not propagated to the child view and vice versa. This serves as a safety mechanism. If you want to delete something from all related views, you have to delete it in each of those views.

Note: The root folder of a view cannot be deleted. If you wish to eliminate it, you must delete the entire view.

To delete a folder:

  1. Select the folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Select Delete from the Folder or context menu. The message “Delete Folder <name>?” displays.

  3. Click OK.

To delete one or more files:

  1. Select the appropriate folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Select the File tab.

  3. Select the files to be removed from the File list in the upper pane.

  4. Select Delete from the File or context menu.  A message box asks if you want to delete the corresponding working files from the working folders on your computer.

  5. Decide whether the working files should be deleted, then select Yes, No, or Cancel.

  6. Confirm the deletion of each file from the application. After deleting a file, you will no longer see information on the file in the current view.

    7. Note: If a file has the status Not In View, deleting it removes the file from the working folder on your workstation. It does not delete the file from the application because the file is not currently in the application.

To delete items (except for files and audit entries):

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click the Change Request, Requirement, Task, or Topic tab.

  3. Select an item from the upper pane. (You can select multiple change requests.)

  4. Select Delete from the component or context menu. One of the following messages displays:

    • Delete Change Request <#>?

    • Delete Requirement <#>?

    • Delete Task <#> and its sub-tasks?

    • Delete Topic <#> and its sub-topics?

  5. Click OK to confirm the deletion.
